Andy jassie thank you guys and thank you
for spending the time with us here today
we really appreciate it it's it's a
special event and we have two
announcements that we want to make and
so I'm gonna get right to it
and let me start with the first one the
first one is really something that
originated out of customer input which
is the vast majority of what we end up
building comes from customers tell us
matters to them and what we've noticed
for a long time is that we've had a
number of AWS customers who either
operate space satellites or consume from
them and there are lots of examples
digital globe has been a longtime deep
partner with Atos for a long time matte
box processes over a hundred million
miles telemetry data every day to power
its Maps you look at weather risk who
processes more than 200 gigabytes
satellite weather data a day and we also
work with a number of space agencies the
European Space Agency they have
satellites that they that they take data
from to collect terabytes of data about
the current state of the planet or you
can look at NASA and the Jet Propulsion
lab JPL the downloads images from its
Mars Exploration Rover and as stores
that data in AWS and does analytics and
sends instructions back to the rover
itself and the same is true with Blue
Origin very broad number of customers
however what you find and what these
customers tell us all the time is that
it's not so simple dealing with
satellites if you actually want to be
able to upload and download data which
the industry calls up clunking and dump
and and down linking data you first need
a number of antennas what people call
ground stations and you need them
situated all over the world given where
satellites are and how they pass through
the earth and then if you're actually
going to uplink and downlink that data
you have to write all kinds of business
logic and scripts and workflow
to be able to move the data back and
forth and to be able to take that data
and analyze it and use it in
applications and then it also means that
if you want to actually take that data
and do something with it you need it in
some kind of infrastructure to store it
to process it to do analytics on top of
it and to take actions back all those
things are difficult for customers to do
and apart from the complexity of it it's
expensive if you actually work regularly
where you need ground stations or
antennas you have to either buy them or
build them or lease them and it's very
cost effective and then it's all a very
cost it's very expensive I should say
it's not cost-effective and then up
linking and downloading data is also
expensive so that's it was interesting
to us when we thought about that and
customers said to us look there's so
much data in space and there's so many
applications that really want to use
that data that can completely change the
way that we interact with our planet and
the world and the applications and
things we could do why don't just make
this easier and that was interesting we
thought about that we hadn't really been
deeply thinking about doing anything in
this space no pun intended and we we
thought about well we have 19 regions
around the world a region for AWS is a
physical place where we have multiple
data centers with five more coming and
we have you know 57 availability zones
with another 15 comments we have this
really broad global footprint at this
point and what customers want to do when
they interact with the satellite data is
they want to actually get it into some
infrastructure to store it and process
and analyze it and we have so many
customers who are doing so much of this
work anyway in these regions we thought
maybe we can help here and so I'm
excited to announce the launch of AWS
ground station which is the world's
first fully managed global ground
station as a service
[Applause]
maybe not when you were predicting and
so what it is is it's a set of ground
stations and antennas located all over
the world in very close proximity and
very frequently right on the same
grounds as our global infrastructure and
regions and it gives customers on-demand
access to these ground stations no need
to lease them upfront no need to try to
build them or buy them no big upfront
cost you can lease them and pay for it
by the minute with the preview starting
today with a couple of those ground
stations and ten more coming in the
early part of 2019 and here's how it'll
work so you figure out which ground
station that you're gonna want to
interact with you think you identify
which satellite you're gonna interact
with and you said you schedule
effectively a contact time when you want
that satellite to interact with the
chosen ground station when that
satellite is going to pass by in close
proximity to that ground station and
then each of those ground stations have
multiple antennas so you can
simultaneously be downlinking and up
linking that data connection is through
a network but that's in an Amazon
virtual private cloud or EPC
and that data gets downloaded directly
into an Amazon V PC so now it's in your
AWS infrastructure to store durably and
then to do whatever analytics and
processing you want then it means
instead of the old norm where it took
hours or sometimes days depending on how
you were doing it to get it to the
infrastructure to actually process it
it's right there in the region where you
can do it in seconds and then as I said
earlier you pay per use you only pay by
the minute that you use so very exciting
and a total game changer in how people
can interact with satellites
